verses.verse: Righteous <WH6662> are you, O LORD, <WH3068> when <WH3588> I plead <WH7378> with you: yet <WH389> let me talk <WH1696> with you of your judgments: <WH4941> Why <WH4069> does the way <WH1870> of the wicked <WH7563> prosper? <WH6743> why are all <WH3605> they happy <WH7951> that deal very <WH899> treacherously? <WH898>

You have planted <WH5193> them, yes, <WH1571> they have taken root: <WH8327> they grow, <WH3212> yes, <WH1571> they bring <WH6213> forth <WH6213> fruit: <WH6529> you are near <WH7138> in their mouth, <WH6310> and far <WH7350> from their reins. <WH3629>

But you, O LORD, <WH3068> know <WH3045> me: you have seen <WH7200> me, and tried <WH974> my heart <WH3820> toward <WH854> you: pull <WH5423> them out like sheep <WH6629> for the slaughter, <WH2873> and prepare <WH6942> them for the day <WH3117> of slaughter. <WH2028>

How <WH5704> long <WH5704> shall the land <WH776> mourn, <WH56> and the herbs <WH6212> of every <WH3605> field <WH7704> wither, <WH3001> for the wickedness <WH7451> of them that dwell <WH3427> therein? the beasts <WH929> are consumed, <WH5595> and the birds; <WH5775> because <WH3588> they said, <WH559> He shall not see <WH7200> our last <WH319> end.

If <WH3588> you have run <WH7323> with the footmen, <WH7273> and they have wearied <WH3811> you, then how <WH349> can you contend <WH8474> with horses? <WH5483> and if in the land <WH776> of peace, <WH7965> wherein you trusted, <WH982> they wearied you, then how <WH349> will you do <WH6213> in the swelling <WH1347> of Jordan? <WH3383>

For even <WH1571> your brothers, <WH251> and the house <WH1004> of your father, <WH1> even <WH1571> they have dealt treacherously <WH898> with you; yes, <WH1571> they have called <WH7121> a multitude <WH4392> after <WH310> you: believe <WH539> them not, though <WH3588> they speak <WH1696> fair <WH2896> words to you.

I have forsaken <WH5800> my house, <WH1004> I have left <WH5203> my heritage; <WH5159> I have given <WH5414> the dearly beloved <WH3033> of my soul <WH5315> into the hand <WH3709> of her enemies. <WH341>
My heritage <WH5159> is to me as a lion <WH738> in the forest; <WH3293> it cries <WH5414> <WH6963> out against <WH5921> me: therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> have I hated <WH8130> it.

My heritage <WH5159> is to me as a speckled <WH6641> bird, <WH5861> the birds <WH5861> round <WH5439> about are against <WH5921> her; come <WH3212> you, assemble <WH622> all <WH3605> the beasts <WH2416> of the field, <WH7704> come <WH857> to devour. <WH402>

Many <WH7227> pastors <WH7462> have destroyed <WH7843> my vineyard, <WH3754> they have trodden <WH947> my portion <WH2513> under foot, <WH947> they have made <WH5414> my pleasant <WH2532> portion <WH2513> a desolate <WH8077> wilderness. <WH4057>

They have made <WH7760> it desolate, <WH8074> and being desolate <WH8077> it mourns <WH56> to me; the whole <WH3605> land <WH776> is made desolate, <WH8074> because <WH3588> no <WH369> man <WH376> lays <WH7760> it to heart. <WH3820>

The spoilers <WH7703> are come <WH935> on all <WH3605> high <WH8205> places through the wilderness: <WH4057> for the sword <WH2719> of the LORD <WH3068> shall devour <WH398> from the one end <WH7097> of the land <WH776> even to the other end <WH7097> of the land: <WH776> no <WH369> flesh <WH1320> shall have peace. <WH7965>

They have sown <WH2232> wheat, <WH2406> but shall reap <WH7114> thorns: <WH6975> they have put themselves to pain, <WH2470> but shall not profit: <WH3276> and they shall be ashamed <WH954> of your revenues <WH8393> because of the fierce <WH2740> anger <WH639> of the LORD. <WH3068>

Thus <WH3541> said <WH559> the LORD <WH3068> against <WH5921> all <WH3605> my evil <WH7451> neighbors, <WH7934> that touch <WH5060> the inheritance <WH5159> which <WH834> I have caused my people <WH5971> Israel <WH3478> to inherit; <WH5157> Behold, <WH2005> I will pluck <WH5428> them out of their land, <WH127> and pluck <WH5428> out the house <WH1004> of Judah <WH3063> from among <WH8432> them.

And it shall come <WH1961> to pass, after <WH310> that I have plucked <WH5428> them out I will return, <WH7725> and have compassion <WH7355> on them, and will bring <WH7725> them again, <WH7725> every man <WH376> to his heritage, <WH5159> and every man <WH376> to his land. <WH776>

And it shall come <WH1961> to pass, if <WH518> they will diligently learn <WH3925> the ways <WH1870> of my people, <WH5971> to swear <WH7650> by my name, <WH8034> The LORD <WH3068> lives; <WH2416> as they taught <WH3925> my people <WH5971> to swear <WH7650> by Baal; <WH1168> then shall they be built <WH1129> in the middle <WH8432> of my people. <WH5971>
But if <WH518> they will not obey, <WH8085> I will utterly pluck <WH5428> up and destroy <WH6> that nation, <WH1471> said <WH5002> the LORD. <WH3068>
